explicit

Class SCCComputer

  • java.lang.Object
    • prism.PrismComponent
      • explicit.SCCComputer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SCCComputerTarjan

    public abstract class SCCComputer
extends PrismComponent
    Abstract class for (explicit) classes that compute (B)SCCs, i.e. (bottom) strongly connected components, for a model's transition graph.

      • computeTopologicalOrdering

        public static SCCInfo computeTopologicalOrdering(PrismComponent parent,
                                                 Model model,
                                                 boolean withTrivialSCCs)
                                          throws PrismException
        Compute an SCCInfo data structure (topological ordering).
        Parameters:
        parent - PrismComponent (for settings)
        model - the model
        withTrivialSCCs - include trivial SCCs?
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeTopologicalOrdering

        public static SCCInfo computeTopologicalOrdering(PrismComponent parent,
                                                 Model model,
                                                 boolean withTrivialSCCs,
                                                 java.util.function.IntPredicate restrict)
                                          throws PrismException
        Compute an SCCInfo data structure (topological ordering).
        If restrict != null, restricts the underlying graph to only those states s for which restrict.test(s) evaluates to true ("relevant states"). Edges to non-relevant states are ignored and the non-relevant states are not considered as potential initial states.
        Parameters:
        parent - PrismComponent (for settings)
        model - the model
        withTrivialSCCs - include trivial SCCs?
        restrict - predicate that indicates that a state is relevant (null: all states are relevant)
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • forEachSCC

        public static void forEachSCC(PrismComponent parent,
                              Model model,
                              java.util.function.Consumer<java.util.BitSet> sccConsumer)
                       throws PrismException
        Convenience method for functional iteration over the SCCs of a model.
        For each non-trivial SCC, the given consumer's accept method is called with a BitSet containing the state indizes of the states in the SCC.
        Note: The BitSet may be reused during calls to accept. So, if you need to store it, clone it.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent PrismComponent (for access to settings)
        model - the model
        sccConsumer - the consumer
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeSCCs

        public void computeSCCs()
                 throws PrismException
        Compute strongly connected components (SCCs) and notify the consumer. This will only report non-trivial SCCs
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeSCCs

        public void computeSCCs(boolean filterTrivialSCCs)
                 throws PrismException
        Compute strongly connected components (SCCs) and notify the consumer. Ignores trivial SCCS if filterTrivialSCCs is set to true.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeSCCs

        public abstract void computeSCCs(boolean filterTrivialSCCs,
                                 java.util.function.IntPredicate restrictStates)
                          throws PrismException
        Compute strongly connected components (SCCs) and notify the consumer. Ignores trivial SCCS if filterTrivialSCCs is set to true. If restrict != null, restricts the underlying graph to only those states s for which restrict.test(s) evaluates to true ("relevant states"). Edges to non-relevant states are ignored and the non-relevant states are not considered as potential initial states.
        Parameters:
        filterTrivialSCCs - ignore trivial SCCs
        restrict - predicate that indicates that a state is relevant (null: all states are relevant)
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • isTrivialSCC

        protected boolean isTrivialSCC(Model model,
                               int state)
        Returns true if state, assumed to be an SCC, is a trivial SCC, i.e., has no self lopp.
        Parameters:
        model - the model
        state - the state index
